definition: face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc
value/(to be) worth/to happen to/to be on duty

sentences.english: The central bank issued a commemorative 10-yuan bank note to mark the Beijing Olympic Games.
sentences.chinese: 央行爲紀念北京奧運會將發行10圓面值的紀念鈔。
您能找開一張100元面值的鈔票嗎？

sentences.english: So which bill will come next for a makeover?
sentences.chinese: 那麼，哪種面值的鈔票將會成爲下一個改版的呢？

sentences.english: Some old coins are now worth a great deal more than their face value.
sentences.chinese: 一些古幣現在的價值比它的面值大得多。

sentences.english: Amount of shares issued by a share-holding enterprise shall be accounted for as equity at the face value of the shares issued.
sentences.chinese: 股份制企業發行股票，應當按股票面值作爲股本入帳。

sentences.english: The Royal Mail issues a Sapphire Blue 5 stamp.
sentences.chinese: 英國皇家郵政發佈面值5英鎊的寶石藍郵票。

sentences.english: The carrying amount of other payables and accruals approximates to its fair value.
sentences.chinese: 其他應付款項及應計費用的帳面值與其公平值相約。

sentences.english: This is a 8-dollar ticket, you can have 4 rides, 2 dollarseach.
sentences.chinese: 這是一張面值8刀的套票，可以坐4次，每次2刀。

sentences.english: The Bundesbank exchanges damaged euro coins for banknotes at face value.
sentences.chinese: 德國央行以等面值的紙幣兌換了被損壞的歐元硬幣。

sentences.english: The - 500 has the highest denomination of the new euro notes.
sentences.chinese: 500歐元是歐元新鈔中面值最高的紙幣。

sentences.english: First consumers tended to overvalue higher denomination money.
sentences.chinese: 首先消費者傾向於高估大面值貨幣。

sentences.english: Bonds shall be accounted for at par value.
sentences.chinese: 刊行債券時，理賣按債券的面值記帳。

sentences.english: Would you cash these traveler's checks for me? 200 dollars worth.
sentences.chinese: 請替我兌換這些旅行支票，二百元票面值。

sentences.english: Does Clang promote shorts to integers when combined with number literals on ARM targets?
sentences.chinese: 做鏗鏘促進短褲加上數字面值整數ARM目標？

sentences.english: You'll want an array that assigns face values to their numeric descriptions.
sentences.chinese: 您將需要一個把牌面值指定爲數字描述的數組。

definition: fractional currency (coin or note of value smaller than the country's unit of currency)/token (used instead of money for slot machines etc)
flat silver (former coinage)/also written 銀圓|银圆/silver dollar
currency issued by Nationalist Government in 1948
banknote in Jiao units (Mao, one-tenth of yuan)
to publish/to issue (stocks, currency etc)/to release/to distribute (a film)
